result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marielle Lewis

records.addlTxt: All records scanned

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From RCAP requesting bond review

Defendant Marielle Lewis in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 4 in 15CF553 and Ct 2 in 15CF1452 and Cts 1-3 in 15CF1435, the State moves to DRI the balance of the charges as well as 15CF1093. State recommends w/held sentence - 4 yrs prob; 12 mos RCJ and other approp conditions. Defense is free to argue.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Deft may attend medical and psychological appointments. ZCI must be notified prior to defendant leaving the house.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Co-signed by Melvin Lewis, Father. Faxed to ZCI.

Cts 1 & 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Bail Jumping-Felony  Conditions:   No contact with the victim EN LSN (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be meeting with atty and court. Father, mother and Pastor must oversee defendant's behavior. Defendant must obey all rules put in place by mother, father or Pastor. If defendant is not compliant that must be reported to the Court.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03/22/2016-DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND MEDICAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL APPOINTMENTS. DEFENDANT MUST NOTIFY ZCI PRIOR TO LEAVING THE HOME.

Cts 1 & 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Bail Jumping-Felony  Conditions:   No contact with the victim EN LSN (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be meeting with atty and court. Father, mother and Pastor must oversee defendant's behavior. Defendant must obey all rules put in place by mother, father or Pastor. If defendant is not compliant that must be reported to the Court.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Marielle Lewis in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Marielle Lewis in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Defense is asking for bond to be modified per motion. Deft's father, Melville Lewis 4/8/72, is willing to co-sign bond . The Court conducts a colloquy with deft's father.  The State objects to bond modification as requested by defense - argument put on the record.

BTC: bond modification Aggregate total remains for all bonds; $3000.00 cash plus co-signature with father, Melville Lewis, 4/8/1972 with photo ID. Father, Pastor James and Mother must oversee deft's behavior. Deft must obey all rules put in place by mother, father and pastor.  If deft is not compliant, it must be reported to the Court. GPS/house arrest on all files
For reduction of bail
for reduction of bail

Keith O'Donnell

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim EN LSN (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be meeting with atty and court. Preliminary hearing on August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marielle Lewis in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. The State requests cash bond in the amount of $500.00 w/conditions the same as 15CF553

BTC: Bond to be set at $500.00 signature bond. The Court admonishes deft that no more violations will be tolerated. Same conditions as 15CF553  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
